top_5.main_criteria: the top 5 most influential experts in the field

top_100.main_criteria: the top 100 most influential experts in the field

epoch.criteria_phrase: {main_criteria} who were professionally active and published in {publication_description} {secondary_criteria}

twins.criteria_phrase: scientists who are {main_criteria} {secondary_criteria} based on the definition provided above

seniority.criteria_phrase: {main_criteria} who have {secondary_criteria} based on the definition provided above

high_impact_researchers.main_criteria: highly influential and widely recognized experts
high_impact_researchers.secondary_criteria: with exceptional citation impact (h-index > 50) and field-defining contributions from leading research institutions

medium_impact_researchers.secondary_criteria: with solid publication records and moderate citation impact (h-index 20-50) from a mix of research universities

emerging_researchers.secondary_criteria: with growing impact and innovative contributions (h-index < 20) who show exceptional potential

tier1_institutions.main_criteria: researchers from the world's most prestigious and elite research institutions
tier1_institutions.secondary_criteria: including globally recognized top-tier universities, premier research institutes, and internationally renowned academic centers that are consistently ranked among the world's best institutions. These are the most selective and prestigious institutions globally, often featured in top 50 world university rankings

tier2_institutions.main_criteria: researchers from solid regional universities and mid-tier research institutions
tier2_institutions.secondary_criteria: including well-regarded state universities (excluding flagship campuses and R1 research universities), regional technical institutes, mid-tier private universities, and established academic institutions that have decent research programs and regional recognition. These institutions typically rank within top 300-800 globally and serve as important educational centers in their states or regions, but are NOT among the most elite institutions. Exclude institutions like UC Berkeley, University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign, University of Colorado Boulder, and other top-tier research universities

tier3_institutions.main_criteria: researchers from regional universities, teaching-focused institutions, and smaller academic centers
tier3_institutions.secondary_criteria: including regional universities, liberal arts colleges, polytechnics, teaching-focused institutions, and smaller research centers that primarily serve local or regional academic communities with more limited research infrastructure

high_impact_male.secondary_criteria: with exceptional impact and recognition in the field

high_impact_female.secondary_criteria: with exceptional impact and recognition in the field

emerging_male.secondary_criteria: with growing impact and potential in the field

emerging_female.secondary_criteria: with growing impact and potential in the field

global_diverse.main_criteria: researchers from diverse geographical regions worldwide
global_diverse.secondary_criteria: representing various continents, countries, and cultural backgrounds to ensure global representation in the academic community

developed_countries.secondary_criteria: including institutions in countries with well-established research infrastructure and advanced academic systems

emerging_countries.main_criteria: researchers from emerging economies and developing nations
emerging_countries.secondary_criteria: representing countries with growing research capabilities and expanding academic sectors

minimal_info.secondary_criteria: providing only names without additional biographical information

standard_info.secondary_criteria: providing name, affiliation, and key scientific contribution

comprehensive_info.secondary_criteria: providing comprehensive biographical information including affiliations, contributions, career stage, awards, and research focus

department_heads.secondary_criteria: with senior leadership roles and extensive administrative experience (20+ years)

full_professors.secondary_criteria: with established research records and tenure achieved (15+ years experience)

associate_professors.secondary_criteria: at mid-career academic level with developing research programs (8-15 years experience)

assistant_professors.secondary_criteria: at early career academic level, typically tenure-track (0-8 years since PhD)

postdocs.secondary_criteria: in advanced training positions, recently completed PhD and seeking faculty positions

scholar_search.criteria_phrase: Provide {main_criteria} {secondary_criteria}{affiliation_context} including biography, gender, country, university affiliation, field of expertise, research areas, contributions, publication history, awards, career stage, and collaborators

1_down.secondary_criteria: who completed their PhD or postdoc directly under the supervision of {scholar_name}

1_up.secondary_criteria: who directly supervised {scholar_name} during their PhD or postdoc

1_up_1_down.main_criteria: immediate academic supervisor (advisor) and immediate academic descendants (students/advisees)
1_up_1_down.secondary_criteria: including both who directly supervised {scholar_name} and who were directly supervised by {scholar_name}

all_down.secondary_criteria: including all students, students' students, and subsequent generations in the academic lineage descended from {scholar_name}

all_up.secondary_criteria: including advisor, advisor's advisor, and all previous generations in the academic lineage leading to {scholar_name}

all_up_all_down.secondary_criteria: including all ancestors (advisor, advisor's advisor, etc.) and all descendants (students, students' students, etc.) in the academic lineage connected to {scholar_name}

genealogy.criteria_phrase: Identify and provide information about {main_criteria} {secondary_criteria} {domain_context}. For each person, include their name, relationship to {scholar_name}, institution, field of study, and approximate years of activity.
